summary: Valeriy Vladimirovich Kostikov, also known as Kostikov, was a Soviet employee and KGB officer stationed in Mexico City. He is significant to the JFK assassination investigation due to potential connections with Lee Harvey Oswald, specifically regarding Oswald's visa request. Documents suggest Kostikov may have been involved in violent activities and intelligence work, including attempts to cultivate a U.S. government employee and possible connections to Department 13 of the KGB. The documents related to Kostikov span from 1962 to 1982 and include intercepts, messages, and a dispatch related to his activities and contacts in Mexico City, including suspected connections to Central American communist parties.
significance: High. Valeriy Vladimirovich Kostikov's potential involvement with Lee Harvey Oswald and his position as a KGB officer in Mexico City make him a significant figure in the JFK assassination investigation. The number of documents (6) dedicated to him further underscores his importance.
